feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Run functions
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Run functions

entry.content: Support for Python 3.14 runtime is in General Availability. Starting from Python version 3.14 and later, the Python Buildpack uses the uv package manager as the default installer for the dependencies you specify in your requirements.txt file. You can also use pip as the default installer for these versions by setting the GOOGLE_PYTHON_PACKAGE_MANAGER environment variable to pip. For more information, see Specify dependencies in Python.
entry.summary: The Python 3.14 runtime is now generally available. It defaults to using the uv package manager for dependency installation, but you can switch to pip via an environment variable. This update applies to Python versions 3.14 and later.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.14 runtime now generally available

entry.summary: The Node.js 24 runtime is now generally available for use.
entry.title: Feature: Node.js 24 Runtime Now Available

entry.content: Support for Python 3.14 runtime is in Preview. Starting from Python version 3.14 and later, the Python Buildpack uses the UV package manager as the default installer for the dependencies you specify in your requirements.txt file. You can also use pip as the default installer for these versions by setting the GOOGLE_PYTHON_PACKAGE_MANAGER environment variable to pip. For more information, see Specify dependencies in Python.
entry.summary: Google Cloud Functions now offers a preview of the Python 3.14 runtime. This update defaults to the UV package manager for dependency installation via requirements.txt, with an option to switch back to pip.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.14 Runtime Now in Preview

entry.summary: We are excited to announce that Java 25 runtime is now available in preview. This update provides enhanced features and performance for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: Java 25 Runtime Now in Preview

entry.content: Cloud Run functions (1st gen) supports the Node.js 22 runtime at the General Availability release level.
entry.summary: The Node.js 22 runtime is now generally available for Cloud Run (1st gen) functions.
entry.title: Feature: Node.js 22 runtime now available

entry.content: Cloud Run functions now provides an upgrade tool for upgrading 1st gen functions to Cloud Run. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: A new upgrade tool is available to help you migrate your 1st gen Cloud Functions to Cloud Run. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Upgrade tool for 1st gen Cloud Functions

entry.summary: Go 1.24 runtime is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.24 Support

entry.content: Support for Go 1.25 runtime is in Preview. This runtime is available for early testers using existing release candidates.
entry.summary: Go 1.25 runtime now in preview. Available for early testers.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.25 Runtime Now Available

entry.content: Support for Node.js 24 runtime is in Preview. Node.js 24 is in the Current release state and enters long-term support (LTS) in October 2025. For more information, see Node.js v24.0.0 (Current) in the Node.js website.
entry.summary: Node.js 24 runtime now available in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Preview: Node.js 24 runtime

entry.summary: The Go 1.24 runtime is now available in preview for Google Cloud Functions, offering enhanced features and performance.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.24 Runtime Now in Preview

entry.content: Support for the Ruby 3.4 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now generally available. This update enhances the capabilities and performance of your applications running on our platform.
entry.title: Feature: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available

entry.content: Support for the PHP 8.4 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: PHP 8.4 runtime is now generally available. This update provides the latest features and improvements for your PHP applications.
entry.title: Feature: PHP 8.4 runtime now available

entry.content: For Java functions that use functions-framework version 1.4.0 or later, you can now use the logging class java.util.logging.Logger to add a unique execution ID to log outputs.
entry.summary: You can now add a unique execution ID to your Java function logs using `java.util.logging.Logger` if you're using functions-framework version 1.4.0 or later. This helps in tracking individual request executions.
entry.title: Feature: Java logging enhancement
